intro: Leionema lamprophyllum subsp. obovatum, commonly known as the silver-leaved leionema, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of silvery-white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded location. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance.
